text: Of all AOC's accomplishments, the most impressive is -- become the face of the a supposed new generation of Democrats in an election year in which almost every other progressive was beaten in their DEMOCRATIC primaries.

text: I'm just a wiseguy from Ark., but have been a paid full time observer of human behavior for a looooong time. Have to say that stupidity causes more stupid sh-- than arrogance, but the damage coming from stupid sh-- that stems from arrogance tends to be much, much worse.
author: NWADoug

text:
I normally don't consider twitter rantings news. A few nuts can make a looooong string of replies and the other end of the spectrum always tries to blow it out of proportion. Keep those factors in mind. I do.

But even I have to say upon seeing this: Seriously?
author: NWADoug

text: The most famous one is as far from a WS as you can get and still be an old white guy.  He’s a writer known as The “blue ridge muse.” He has called Trump the “white trash president.”
author: NWADoug

text: Seriously, he didn't even insult the right "Doug Thompson." Either that or he/she thinks "white supremacist" is the most likely insult to get a rise out of me.
author: NWADoug

text: The 8th Circuit has suspended the deadline until it can consider and rule on the request for a formal delay. The government has until April 1 to reply, so -- assuming the court will not rule until there is a chance to reply, there is a de facto delay until at least April 1.
author: NWADoug

text: The “Abolish the electoral college” debate is a distraction from things that could actually happen. It is also a pretty pathetic headline grab. People promising things they cannot deliver is how we got in this mess in the first place.

text: If I recall correctly, it was during a 1956 integration lawsuit by the NAACP against the Little Rock School District.
author: NWADoug

text: One should also note that, in slave states right through the Jim Crow era, whites always addressed blacks by first name. Civil rights leader Daisy Bates caused quite a stir back in the day by insisting a white lawyer stop calling her "Daisy" during a court proceeding.
author: NWADoug

text:
Also -- whites routinely referred to blacks by their first names during Jim Crow days.

Civil rights activist Daisy Bates insisted from the witness stand that a white attorney call her "Mrs. Bates," not "Daisy," during a court proceeding, for instance.
author: NWADoug

text:
At the time, that took courage.

Outrage addiction combined with ignorance of history is a potent thing.

Seriously, even pop culture used to know about this particular issue.

"What do they call you up there?"

"They call me Mr. Tibbs."
author: NWADoug

text:
The segregationist lawyer cross-examining civil rights crusader Daisy Bates in Little Rock kept calling her "Daisy," as whites did back in Jim Crow days.

Mrs. Bates informed him from the witness stand that her name was Mrs. Bates.

1/2
author: NWADoug

text:
Interviewed the U.S. Attorney in 2015 about the strategic switch to "lone wolf" terrorism. There is literature on the subject -- written by these groups' leaders.

Could write that story again tomorrow. Just as relevant. 2/2
author: NWADoug

text:
This could well take the prize for the most willfully blind thing the POTUS has said yet.

I'm just a wiseguy in Arkansas, but I spent years covering white supremacist trials while I was on state desk. 1/2
author: NWADoug
